chess

Class Chess

  • java.lang.Object
    • chess.Chess

  • public class Chess
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is to run the chess game. The game is initialized with the starting player as White, and the opponent as Black Input for each move can be up to 3 arguments separated by spaces. Game will continue as long as a checkmate does not exist, or a player resigns, or both players agree to draw.
    Author:
    Ryan Sadofsky

      • draw_initialized

        public static boolean draw_initialized
        Set to true if one player asks for a draw. If the other player does not respond positively on the next turn, the value is set back to false

      • currentEnPassant

        public static ChessPiece currentEnPassant
        ChessPiece which the opponent has one move to attack through en passant currentEnPassant is removed/changed after every turn

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)

      • applyPromotion

        public static void applyPromotion(Coords c,
                                  java.lang.String s)
        This method will promote a pawn, with the value of 's' determining the piece the Pawn will be promoted to. On default, if 's' is blank, the Pawn will be promoted to a Queen
        Parameters:
        c - Coords object with position of Pawn to be promoted
        s - Single character string indicating the piece the player wants to promote their pawn to

      • pieceAt

        public static ChessPiece pieceAt(Coords c)
        Returns the ChessPiece object at the position of Coords c
        Parameters:
        c - Coords object holding the position of the piece you want to retrieve
        Returns:
        ChessPiece at position c.x,c.y

                                       Coords start,

        Determines whether or not a castling attempt is valid
        Parameters:
        p - King being moved
        start - start position of piece
        destination - end position of piece
        Returns:
        boolean

      • verifyMove

        public static boolean verifyMove(ChessPiece piece,
                                 Coords start,
                                 Coords destination)
        Verifies that the move specified by the player is valid
        Parameters:
        piece - piece to move
        start - position of piece
        destination - where you want to move piece to
        Returns:
        true if move is verified, false otherwise and the move will not occur

      • isSelfDestructive

        public static boolean isSelfDestructive(Coords start,
                                        Coords destination)
        Determines if this move puts the player's own king in check
        Parameters:
        start - chess piece's starting position
        destination - chess piece's destination
        Returns:
        true if this move will result in placing the player's own king in check, otherwise false

      • hasClearPath

        public static boolean hasClearPath(ChessPiece piece,
                                   Coords start,
                                   Coords destination)
        Determines whether or not the path from start to destination is blocked by one of the player's own pieces
        Parameters:
        piece - ChessPiece being moved
        start - start position of piece
        destination - end position of piece
        Returns:
        false if the path from start to destination is blocked by one of the player's own pieces, otherwise true

        Parameters:

        Determines whether the player's King is under check or checkmate
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • canSaveKing

        public static boolean canSaveKing(ChessPiece p,
                                  Coords position)
        Checks if any valid move of piece p can get King out of check
        Parameters:
        p - Chess piece to try to save King
        position - Coords position of ChessPiece p
        Returns:
        true if the piece has a valid move to save the king, false otherwise

      • CheckForCheck

        public static boolean CheckForCheck(java.lang.String attackingPlayer)
        Determines if the attacking player puts their opponent's king in check
        Parameters:
        attackingPlayer - Player who is checking their opponent's King
        Returns:
        true if the opponent's King is in check, otherwise false

      • FileRankToCoords

        public static Coords FileRankToCoords(java.lang.String filerank)
        Converts FileRank (ex: 'd7') to row,column position on the game board as a Coords object
        Parameters:
        filerank - String such as "e2" to convert to row, column numeric values
        Returns:
        Coords object holding the row (x) , column (y) values
